title: Antivenom Dosing Algorithm
description: Doses antivenom (CroFab only, not Anavip) for pit viper snakebites. This unified treatment algorithm assists with quick identification and management of patients who may benefit from treatment with Crotalidae Polyvalent Immune Fab (CroFab®).

parameters.name: signs_of_envenomation
parameters.description: Presence of signs of envenomation including swelling, tenderness, redness, ecchymosis, or blebs at bite site; elevated protime, decreased fibrinogen or platelets; systemic signs (hypotension, bleeding beyond puncture site, refractory vomiting, diarrhea, angioedema, neurotoxicity)

parameters.name: severity_grade
parameters.description: Clinical severity grade of envenomation based on local, systemic, and hematologic effects

parameters.name: patient_weight_kg
parameters.description: Patient weight in kilograms (dosing is same for adults and pediatrics)

result.name: initial_dose_vials
result.description: Initial dose of CroFab antivenom in vials

ranges.interpretation: No signs of envenomation present. Monitor patient closely for progression. Provide supportive care including tetanus prophylaxis, wound care, and pain management. Mark leading edge of any swelling every 15-30 minutes.

Administer 4-6 vials CroFab IV over 60 minutes. Monitor for initial control of envenomation (arrest of local effects, resolution of systemic effects, reduction of hematologic abnormalities). If initial control not achieved in ~1 hour, administer additional 4-6 vials. Once initial control achieved, give maintenance doses of 2 vials every 6 hours for 3 doses (at 6, 12, and 18 hours).

ranges.description: Higher initial antivenom dose for severe cases
ranges.interpretation: Administer 6-12 vials CroFab IV over 60 minutes for severe envenomation. Monitor for initial control of envenomation. May require additional doses if control not achieved. Once initial control achieved, give maintenance doses of 2 vials every 6 hours for 3 doses (at 6, 12, and 18 hours). Contact poison control (1-800-222-1222).

references: Lavonas EJ, Ruha AM, Banner W, et al. Unified treatment algorithm for the management of crotaline snakebite in the United States: results of an evidence-informed consensus workshop. BMC Emerg Med. 2011;11:2. doi: 10.1186/1471-227X-11-2

Dart RC, Seifert SA, Boyer LV, et al. A randomized multicenter trial of crotalinae polyvalent immune Fab (ovine) antivenom for the treatment for crotaline snakebite in the United States. Arch Intern Med. 2001;161(16):2030-2036.
CroFab® Prescribing Information. BTG International Inc.; August 2018.
formula: Algorithm-based dosing: Initial dose 4-6 vials (up to 12 for severe cases), additional 4-6 vials if control not achieved, maintenance 2 vials q6h x 3 doses
notes: Use only for symptomatic crotalid snake envenomation (pit vipers including rattlesnakes, cottonmouths, and copperheads) in the US
For CroFab administration only - do not use for Anavip dosing
Do not use for coral snake envenomation or non-US indigenous snakes
Not valid for snakebites on head/neck, snakebites causing rhabdomyolysis, or anaphylaxis/anaphylactoid reactions
Report all cases to poison control: 1-800-222-1222
Avoid: cutting/suctioning wound, ice, NSAIDs, prophylactic antibiotics, fasciotomy, electrical shock, steroids (unless allergic), tourniquets
Initial control requires: arrest of local effects, resolution of systemic effects, reduction of hematologic abnormalities
Maintenance therapy may not be needed if close physician-expert observation available
Follow-up: bleeding precautions for 2 weeks, lab monitoring at 2-3 days and 5-7 days post-discharge
